channel.title: Home schooling
channel.description:
Do you agree with home schooling? In England it's getting more popular. Most people think ahhh no homework, but technically your doing homework anyway. You don't make any friends, you make friends outside of school.
Whats your opinion?

item.title: Home schooling
item.dc:creator: @jme jme
item.description:
@jme wrote:

xEnt:

come to think of it, everyone ive met who were home schooled are fucking retarded.

Yeah we used to mess with some homeschooled kids that switched to public school. They had like no concept of sex lol.

Read full topic

[quote author=american_girl link=topic=337769.msg2710049#msg2710049 date=1237246440]if you look at schools you have the outcasts or loners or w/e you call them. they dont socialize. same with homeschooling, the people who dont socialize either choose not to or are strange.

Yes, that roughly sums up the first 12 years of my life.[/quote]

umm ok then java…

item.title: Home schooling
item.dc:creator: @american_girl american_girl
item.description:
@american_girl wrote:

ok i see your point. and there are people like that in homeschooling. but where i am they have sports groups, prom, field trips, and they even have a co-op once a week for classes. if you look at schools you have the outcasts or loners or w/e you call them. they dont socialize. same with homeschooling, the people who dont socialize either choose not to or are strange. like i said before its just a matter of wanting to socialize, i go out every weekend with friends, i have a boyfriend, and i can learn at my own pace. there are up and downs to both, im not saying homeschoolers are superior (believe me we aren’t) but it works for me.

Read full topic

item.title: Home schooling
item.dc:creator: @goatee goatee
item.description:
@goatee wrote:

You learn so much at school, the lessons are just a measurement of your intelligence and shit. But there’s the whole social aspect of school, you meet different people from different backgrounds and you learn to adapt to different people. When you are home schooled you spend less time with other people so you just learn how to be around you parent/tutor but no one else. Your mind doesn’t socially mature which is why you can still be smart but you’re socially fucked up.

Read full topic

item.title: Home schooling
item.dc:creator: @cooper cooper
item.description:
@cooper wrote:

american_girl:

this is my third year homeschooling, and i hated it at first esp all the amish looking people wearing long skirts and crap, but its really not that bad, esp if you keep in touch with old friends and have other activities. i hate it when people say we have no social life. its a gay generlization of us.

Amish looking people? Why are there Amish looking people in your home?

Read full topic

item.title: Home schooling
item.dc:creator: @american_girl american_girl
item.description:
@american_girl wrote:

haha thanks love you too. its not that bad but its just a stupid thing to say. i socialize prolly more than i should

Read full topic

item.description:

Not X A Alex:

I was just recently kicked out of school and am doing home schooling, its fun, it hasn’t fucked me socially, me and my mates still hangout on weekends etc, so it hasn’t really gotten in the way.

Nice i suppose :P.

item.title: Home schooling
item.dc:creator: @R.I.P_RSC R.I.P RSC
item.description:
@R.I.P_RSC wrote:

I agree that home schooling isn’t good. Sometimes it sounds attractive, but in the end, going to a normal school is way better. Sitting in a class will cause you to learn better, as long as you pay attention. Others ask questions that you didn’t think off, and you get more knowledge. But this only applies if the class your in is a bit serious. My previous classmates were annoying, they kept talking to each other while the teacher was explaining something. I prefer to listen and learn that way. This also means less time spent on actually reading the books.

Read full topic
